pages.text: The $(item)Hand Crank/$ can be used to manually supply a weak amount of $(bold)$(l:getting_started/stress)Stress/$ to $(bold)$(l:getting_started/devices)Mechanical Devices/$. Holding $(bold)$(k:use)/$ will rotate it counter-clockwise, while $(bold)Sneaking/$ while holding $(bold)$(k:use)/$ will rotate it clockwise.$(ponder)
Note that the $(item)Hand Crank/$ will consume a large amount of $(thing)Hunger/$ while using it.

The $(item)Water Wheel/$ is the simplest method of automatic $(bold)$(l:getting_started/stress)Stress/$ generation available. By running $(item)Water/$ (or $(item)Lava/$) over the blades in the appropriate direction over 3 sides, up to 256 $(bold)$(l:getting_started/stress)su/$ can be generated. Up to 320 $(thing)su/$ can be generated by adding a $(thing)Bubble Column/$ up the back.$(ponder)

pages.title: Windmill
pages.text: A $(item)Windmill/$ is a $(bold)$(l:contraptions)Contraption/$ which can be used for generating mechanical $(bold)$(l:getting_started/stress)Stress/$. By attaching $(item)Sails/$ to a $(item)Windmill Bearing/$, $(thing)Stress/$ can be generated proportional to the number of sails attached.$(br2)$(bold)$(l:getting_started/ponder)Ponder/$ both items presented for more information.

pages.title: Sail
pages.text: $(item)Sail/$ blocks can be attached to blocks and each other without having to use $(bold)$(l:getting_started/create_tools)Superglue/$. They can be used to generate power when part of windmill, as well as some other blocks such as $(item)Wool Blocks/$ or $(item)Empty Sail Frames/$. See the next page for crafting recipes.

The $(item)Steam Engine/$ is the most powerful form of $(bold)$(l:getting_started/stress)Stress/$ generation. A $(thing)Steam Engine/$ can be constructed by building a boiler out of $(bold)$(l:fluids)Fluid Tanks/$, heating it with either $(item)Capfires/$ or $(bold)$(l:advanced_automation/adv_devices)Blaze Burners/$, and then attaching the $(item)Steam Engine(s)/$ to the boiler.$(ponder)
$(br2)Looking at a $(thing)Boiler/$ while wearing $(bold)$(l:getting_started/create_tools#goggles)Engineer's Goggles/$ will let you see more information.
